trial_identification.studytitle: The Impact of Micronutrients on Gene Expression in Prostate Cancer: Lycopene
trial_identification.scientifictitle: The Impact of Micronutrients on Gene Expression in Prostate Cancer: Lycopene

interventions.interventions: Lycopene - oral supplement 3 times daily - 15-90mg for 6-10 weeks; differs on a case-by-case basis as determined by clinician

primaryOutcome.outcome: Global gene expression via blood and tissue analysis

secondaryOutcome.outcome: A range of markers measured using blood analysis, including: full blood count, PSA, lipids, IGF-1, IGFBP3

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: (1) Age 35-80 years (2) Non-smoker (3) Patients with a diagnosis of clinically localised prostate cancer who are scheduled to undergo radical prostatectomy in 6-8 weeks (4) Normal liver function tests, as verification that the tumour is localized to the prostate gland
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: (1) No diagnosis of prostate cancer (2) Body mass index <18.5kg/m2 (underweight) or >35kg/m2 (obese class II) (3) Current infection (4) Prior therapy for prostate cancer (e.g. chemotherapy; radiation therapy; hormonal therapy) (5) Current consumption of testosterone replacement medicines (6) Current consumption of 5-alpha-reductase inhibitors (7) Consumption of other herbal or nutritional supplements, apart from a single multi-vitamin tablet (8) Inability to provide informed consent due to diminished understanding or comprehension, or a language other than English spoken and an interpreter unavailable

trial_design.designfeatures: Patients serve as their own control

fundingsource.fundingname: Sanofi Aventis Prostate Cancer Research Award
fundingsource.fundingaddress: Clinical Oncological Society of Australia Level 1, 120 Chalmers Street Surry Hills NSW 2010

Princess Alexandra Hospital Ipswich Road, Woolloongabba QLD 4102

ethicsAndSummary.summary: The purpose of this study is to conduct a small, translational research trial in a group of men with prostate cancer, to determine the whole-genome effects of lycopene supplementation.
